generated.title: GeneratedElectricPotential
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'ElectricPotential'

description*.en: The Electric Potential is a scalar valued quantity associated with an electric field. The electric potential $\phi(x)$ at a point, $x$, is formally defined as the line integral of the electric field taken along a path from x to the point at infinity. If the electric field is static, that is time independent, then the choice of the path is arbitrary; however if the electric field is time dependent, taking the integral a different paths will produce different results.

title: ElectricPotential
description: The Electric Potential is a scalar valued quantity associated with an electric field. The electric potential $\phi(x)$ at a point, $x$, is formally defined as the line integral of the electric field taken along a path from x to the point at infinity. If the electric field is static, that is time independent, then the choice of the path is arbitrary; however if the electric field is time dependent, taking the integral a different paths will produce different results.
